term.name: conceptualism
term.source: From Latin conceptum: something conceived, an idea.
term.def: The view that conceptual knowledge consists of non-arbitrary abstractions from perceptual knowledge, but that concepts do not have an independent existence. Conceptualism thus opposes both &nominalism; and &realism;. Although the main conceptualist in philosophical history was Peter Abailard (1079-1142), &aristotelianism; is also sometimes considered to be a form of conceptualism.
